result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven W Scherbarth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution Total:  $1647.82 - $100.00 to Pawn American and $1,547.82 (the balance) to be paid to Ken K.

To be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Restitution to be paid before costs and surcharge.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with: the victim.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven W Scherbarth in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court advises of right to an attorney.  
State recites recommendation and criminal history to the court.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation and return at 1:30.

Case recalled at 2:00.  Defendant is not eligible for PD appointment.  Defendant sworn and questioned by the Court.  Court finds the defendant indigent and appoints Atty. Sarah Ponath.  Repayment of fees to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing 4-15-15.
Hearing on March 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing
